result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

from JSS   re: on 6-3-2022 the No Contact w/ lifted from def's bond but GPS exclusion zone remains - can GPS exclusion zone be lifted?
Per TWB:  Verify w/ DA's office.  I would think the GPS was to come off & the exclusion zone would be removed from bond as well.  If DA's office disagrees, set another bond Hrg
Note: per ADA Donskey:  yes, I agree the GPS can/should be removed since the No Contact was lifted

11:34 am - Def in court w/Atty Thomas J Rhodes.  Emily E Ruud appeared for the State of Wisconsin.TWB for RAG
Ruud requests Court take judicial notice of bond that was in effect at time of incident. 
CT:  Takes judicial notice 
Officer Heath Graves - sworn and testifies:  Gives testimony - witness identifies defendant. 
11:44 am - X by Rhodes:  Gives testimony
11:48 am - Re-direct by Ruud: Givest testimony
WITNESS EXCUSED
Rhodes objects to bindover
Probable cause found - Bindover
Information filed - Reading waived 
Advised of charges/penalties
Def stands mute - NG plea entered
PTC: 6/24/22 @ 3:30 (DA)
STC: 7/21/22 @ 10am (RAG) 
Rhodes addresses bond - requests  No contact w/T.E. removed
Ruud comments - State has concerns but leaves to Court's discretion. 
CT:  Grants request

Rhodes waives PH time limits.  Mr. Broadnax and I met in person yesterday and discussed this issued.
Court finds good cause to go beyond the time limits.
